TEXT.P: The graph at left shows "Hubbert's Curve." This curve represents a theoretical prediction of how production of a nonrenewable resource should behave through time.

The essential assumption of Hubbert's Curve is that there is a fixed amount of resource available. So, although production may grow rapidly at first, it must eventually peak and decline as the resource is depleted.
Using this curve, Hubbert accurately predicted the peak of U.S. oil production in 1970.
